original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 67.
    Returns: the average of their average that they have to run over the final three days.
    """
    # L1
    days_first_period_jesse = 3 # On the first three days
    jesse_avg_first_period = Fraction(2, 3) # Jesse averages (2/3) of a mile
    jesse_miles_first_period = days_first_period_jesse * jesse_avg_first_period

    # L2
    total_race_distance = 30 # run 30 miles
    jesse_day4_miles = 10 # On day four she runs 10 miles
    jesse_miles_remaining = total_race_distance - jesse_day4_miles - jesse_miles_first_period

    # L3
    remaining_days = 3 # final three days
    jesse_avg_remaining_days = jesse_miles_remaining / remaining_days

    # L4
    mia_days_first_period = 4 # over the first 4 days
    mia_avg_first_period = 3 # Mia averages 3 miles a day
    mia_miles_first_period = mia_days_first_period * mia_avg_first_period

    # L5
    mia_miles_remaining = total_race_distance - mia_miles_first_period

    # L6
    mia_avg_remaining_days = mia_miles_remaining / remaining_days

    # L7
    total_avg_remaining_days = jesse_avg_remaining_days + mia_avg_remaining_days

    # L8
    number_of_people = 2 # average of their average
    final_average_per_day = total_avg_remaining_days / number_of_people

    # FA
    answer = final_average_per_day
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Jesse runs {jesse_miles_first_period} miles in the first three days because {days_first_period_jesse} x {jesse_avg_first_period} = <<{days_first_period_jesse}*{jesse_avg_first_period}={jesse_miles_first_period}>>{jesse_miles_first_period}

Jesse has {jesse_miles_remaining} miles left to run because {total_race_distance} - {jesse_day4_miles} - {jesse_miles_first_period} = <<{total_race_distance}-{jesse_day4_miles}-{jesse_miles_first_period}={jesse_miles_remaining}>>{jesse_miles_remaining}

Jesse has to run an average of {jesse_avg_remaining_days} miles a day because {jesse_miles_remaining} / {remaining_days} = <<{jesse_miles_remaining}/{remaining_days}={jesse_avg_remaining_days}>>{jesse_avg_remaining_days}

Mia runs {mia_miles_first_period} miles over the first four days because {mia_days_first_period} x {mia_avg_first_period} = <<{mia_days_first_period}*{mia_avg_first_period}={mia_miles_first_period}>>{mia_miles_first_period}

She has {mia_miles_remaining} miles left to run because {total_race_distance} - {mia_miles_first_period} = <<{total_race_distance}-{mia_miles_first_period}={mia_miles_remaining}>>{mia_miles_remaining}
She has to run six miles a day because {mia_miles_remaining} / {remaining_days} = <<{mia_miles_remaining}/{remaining_days}={mia_avg_remaining_days}>>{mia_avg_remaining_days}
The total they both have to run is <<{total_avg_remaining_days}={total_avg_remaining_days}>>{total_avg_remaining_days} miles a day

The average they have to run per day on average is {final_average_per_day} miles because {total_avg_remaining_days} / {number_of_people} = <<{total_avg_remaining_days}/{number_of_people}={final_average_per_day}>>{final_average_per_day}
